title: Vice-president of Serbian team who racially abused Partizan star Everton Luiz launches shocking Facebook rant over ‘fake tears’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE vice-president of shamed Serbian side FK Rada has sensationally claimed that racially abused Partizan star Everton Luiz should ‘go back to Brazil and show your dark fingers to them’. 
Jelena Polic took to Facebook to launch an extraordinary rant after her side were slammed worldwide following the treatment of Luiz in their last league match. Everton Luiz leaves field in tears after being abused by racist football fans 6 The post written in Serbian is a stark reminder of the horrific racial aggravation still rife in Serbia 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news, gossip and rumours 
Supporters from the home section directed monkey chants towards the Brazilian and Luiz responded at the full-time whistle by showing his middle finger to the fans. 
But Polic seemingly has no sympathy for the Partizan player following a deleted Facebook post that translated to: "The whole story about this "big" Everton player and the stuff that happened on the game between Rad and Partizan is biased and sad. FK Rada vice-president Jelena Polic has reportedly taken to Facebook to launch a shocking rant Getty Images 6 Everton Luiz left the field in floods of tears after being racially abused by Rad fans 
"Why don't you mention how many insults "mister" crybaby said to Nikola Drincic during the game, he hit Vladimir Rodic and showed the middle finger to the fans. But we are racist and nationalistic! 
"Apparently we have to respect others more than ourselves, to be proud when in the "TITO" team (Partizan) has 7 foreign players. and then fake tears, fake "I love Serbia and I see it as my house" story. 
"Well, why don't you go back to Brazil and show your dark fingers to them and swear on brazilians mothers and everything will be ok. 
"NO TO RACISM (insert sarcastic smileys)." The 28-year-old hit back at the supporters insisting he wants to fight racism and show the abusers that he is stronger. 
Speaking to the Mail he said: "That hasn't passed my mind. I need to show them that we are stronger 
"We can't simply choose to run away. I will always fight against these types of people. 
"I want my children to grow up strong and knowing that, yes, these things can happen. 
"Unfortunately it's not just here that there are people with these kinds of attitudes. But I also don't want them to suffer. If it hurts me this much, I can't imagine them hurting too."
